description: I use Thunderbord as my email client but never got it to integrate with the Gnome desktop quite right. Tried a few different notification add-ons and they all had *some* problem (multiple notifications for same mail, encoding) + Thunderbird needs to be open all the time. Mailnag closes that gap. libnotify default notifications are all I need but there're also extensions for Gnome Shell and Unity. Easy setup, runs transparently as a daemon.
Won't connect to GMail address making it pointless for a large amount of users. I suspect the security certification and/or protocol is not sufficient for Google.

Push notifications on desktop
Integrates with system
Works with Gmail 
I found no issue on Fedora26+Gnome3

Perfect app for me.
Jep, cool tool and works fine, but could you just change the storing of password. There are ways to do this, but it shouldn't exist a line password=****** . Everybody can read this.
summary: Works great, but password is in .config/mailnag readable
